snippet: Getting the blessing of the Federal Trade Commission, which stopped a Staples-Office Depot deal in 1997, might be tougher than expected, Quentin Webb writes in Reuters Breakingviews.
abstract: Getting the blessing of the Federal Trade Commission, which stopped a Staples-Office Depot deal in 1997, might be tougher than expected, Quentin Webb writes in Reuters Breakingviews.
lead_paragraph: A potential $13 billion merger of Staples and Office Depot looks great, in theory at least. The activist investment firm Starboard Value has taken big stakes in each of America’s two remaining large office supply chains and, according to CNBC, wants to merge them.

headline.main: A Potential Staples-Office Depot Deal Not Easy to Get Past Regulators
